isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - CONTROL VALVE

svcproc.title: CONTROL VALVE
svcproc.para: If the O-rings or parts in the control valve are defective, there will be a constant air leak out the exhaust located on the bottom of the control valve.
A defective insert valve O-ring will result in a constant leak through the exhaust in both ranges and valve will not make range shifts.
A defective housing O-ring will result in a constant, low volume leak through the exhaust in low range only.

If the slide is assembled backwards, there will be a constant leak through the exhaust in high range. When installing the slide in the control valve, make sure that the slot in the slide faces the outlet port.

step1.para: Place the control valve with rear housing (inlet side) on a bench and remove the four screws to separate front and rear housings.
Remove the slide and the two position balls and springs.
Remove the flat metal seal from the outlet side and remove O-ring from the body.
Remove the valve insert from the front housing and remove the O-ring from the valve insert.
Remove the wave washer installed under valve insert.
Remove the two felt wipers from the valve housings.
Punch out the roll pin and remove the control button from the slide.
